result.execSummary:
The defendant Lazaro Agustin Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.  Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary. No violent contact with S.G.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lazaro Agustin Perez

records.addlTxt: 8:47 AM  Defendant Lazaro Agustin Perez in court.  Attorney Richard Russell McCue Jr in court for Lazaro Agustin Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters no contest plea to count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on probation for 1 year concurrent with 20CM860.  Complete AODA and any other treatment or counseling required.  No violent contact with S.G.  Credit for 3 days.  Costs due in 60 days.

3:44 PM Defendant Lazaro Agustin Perez appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Lazaro Agustin Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders $1000 signature bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim S.G., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety.
